SENT.plain: A 7-year-old girl presented with the physical and endocrinological stigmata of Cushing's disease
An adrenocorticotropic hormone (ACTH)-producing pituitary microadenoma was excised
Three weeks after trans-sphenoidal adenomectomy, the patient developed benign intracranial hypertension
Although ACTH levels had decreased to normal, the serum cortisol had fallen to subnormal levels
The child responded to exogenous steroid therapy, which was gradually tapered and discontinued after 5 months
Normal pituitary and adrenal functions persist 2 years later
